prompt:
You are a PostgreSQL expert. Given an input question, first create a syntactically correct PostgreSQL query to run, then look at the results of the query and return the answer to the input question.
Unless the user specifies in the question a specific number of examples to obtain, query for at most 5 results using the LIMIT clause as per PostgreSQL. You can order the results to return the most informative data in the database.
Never query for all columns from a table. You must query only the columns that are needed to answer the question. Wrap each column name in double quotes (") to denote them as delimited identifiers.
Pay attention to use only the column names you can see in the tables below. Be careful to not query for columns that do not exist. Also, pay attention to which column is in which table.

Use the following format:

Question: "Question here"
SQLQuery: "SQL Query to run"
SQLResult: "Result of the SQLQuery"
Answer: "Final answer here"

Only use the following tables:
CREATE TABLE "public"."source_sentiment" (
id integer NOT NULL, category text , source text , sentiment double precision ) 
SELECT * FROM "public"."source_sentiment" LIMIT 3;
 id category source sentiment
 1 Occupational Health Research http://globo.com/vel/est/donec/odio/justo/sollicitudin.html?sit=id&amet=lobortis&consectetuer=convallis&adipiscing=tortor&elit=risus&proin=dapibus&interdum=augue 0.559
 2 Behavioral Health Research http://ucsd.edu/nibh/quisque/id/justo/sit/amet/sapien.aspx?blandit=curae&mi=duis&in=faucibus&porttitor=accumsan&pede=odio&justo=curabitur&eu=convallis&massa=duis&donec=consequat&dapibus=dui&duis=nec&at=nisi&velit=volutpat&eu=eleifend&est=donec&congue=ut 0.572
 3 Mental Health Research http://unesco.org/vivamus/in/felis/eu/sapien/cursus.html?curae=integer&nulla=aliquet&dapibus=massa&dolor=id&vel=lobortis&est=convallis&donec=tortor&odio=risus&justo=dapibus&sollicitudin=augue&ut=vel&suscipit=accumsan&a=tellus&feugiat=nisi&et=eu&eros=orci&vestibulum=mauris&ac=lacinia&est=sapien&lacinia=quis&nisi=libero&venenatis=nullam&tristique=sit&fusce=amet&congue=turpis&diam=elementum&id=ligula&ornare=vehicula&imperdiet=consequat&sapien=morbi&urna=a&pretium=ipsum&nisl=integer&ut=a&volutpat=nibh&sapien=in&arcu=quis&sed=justo&augue=maecenas&aliquam=rhoncus&erat=aliquam&volutpat=lacus&in=morbi&congue=quis&etiam=tortor&justo=id&etiam=nulla&pretium=ultrices&iaculis=aliquet&justo=maecenas&in=leo&hac=odio&habitasse=condimentum&platea=id&dictumst=luctus&etiam=nec&faucibus=molestie&cursus=sed&urna=justo&ut=pellentesque&tellus=viverra&nulla=pede&ut=ac&erat=diam&id=cras&mauris=pellentesque&vulputate=volutpat&elementum=dui&nullam=maecenas&varius=tristique&nulla=est&facilisi=et&cras=tempus&non=semper&velit=est&nec=quam&nisi=pharetra&vulputate=magna&nonummy=ac&maecenas=consequat&tincidunt=metus&lacus=sapien 0.43


Question: Make a bulleted list of the 10 categories with the average sentiment and the average's absolute distance from 0.5.  Order the list by the average's absolute distance from 0.5, but return only the category and average sentiment.  After each category tell me if the category is positive or negative where >0.5 is positive and <0.5 is negative.
SQLQuery: SELECT category, AVG(sentiment), ABS(AVG(sentiment)-0.5) AS abs_dist FROM "public"."source_sentiment" GROUP BY category ORDER BY abs_dist DESC LIMIT 10;
SQLResult: [{"category":"Environmental Health Research","avg":0.5924516129032258,"abs_dist":0.09245161290322579},{"category":"Alternative Medicine Research","avg":0.4275625,"abs_dist":0.07243749999999999},{"category":"Cancer Research","avg":0.571125,"abs_dist":0.071125},{"category":"Health Care Delivery Research","avg":0.42975,"abs_dist":0.07024999999999998},{"category":null,"avg":0.43227999999999994,"abs_dist":0.06772000000000006},{"category":"Substance Abuse Research","avg":0.4457241379310345,"abs_dist":0.05427586206896551},{"category":"Nutrition Research","avg":0.5495384615384614,"abs_dist":0.04953846153846142},{"category":"Pharmaceutical Research","avg":0.4525882352941176,"abs_dist":0.047411764705882375},{"category":"Health Policy Research","avg":0.4542,"abs_dist":0.04580000000000001},{"category":"Genetics Research","avg":0.543421052631579,"abs_dist":0.04342105263157903}]
Answer:
